name: DevContainerBuildRun
description: Build and run VS Code dev containers in Azure DevOps Pipelines
author: Stuart Leeks

inputs.name: runCmd
inputs.label: Specify the command to run after building the dev container image

inputs.name: subFolder
inputs.label: Specify a child folder (containing a .devcontainer) instead of using the repository root

inputs.name: env
inputs.label: Specify environment variables to pass to the docker run command

inputs.name: push

options.filter: Push if buildReasonsForPush, sourceBranchFilterForPush, and pushOnFailedBuild conditions are met

inputs.label: Control when images are pushed to the registry

inputs.name: buildReasonsForPush
inputs.label: Set the Build Reasons that should trigger a push of the dev container image . Defaults to Manual, IndividualCI, BatchedCI. (see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/build/variables?view=azure-devops&viewFallbackFrom=vsts&tabs=yaml)

inputs.name: sourceBranchFilterForPush
inputs.label: Set the source branches (e.g. refs/heads/main) that are allowed to trigger a push of the dev container image. Leave empty to allow all.

inputs.name: skipContainerUserIdUpdate
inputs.label: For non-root dev containers (i.e. where `remoteUser` is specified), the action attempts to make the container user UID and GID match those of the host user. Set this to true to skip this step (defaults to false)

inputs.name: privileged
inputs.label: Control whether extended privileges are given to the dev container (i.e. using --privileged option). This is needed for dev containers configured with docker-in-docker. Set this to true to grant extended privileges (defaults to false)
